text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f7779c63d4fe531e2483502d4441f24802342768|patch 8.2.0684: Vim9: memory leak when using lambda>
patch 8.2.0684: Vim9: memory leak when using lambda

Problem:    Vim9: memory leak when using lambda.
Solution:   Move the funccal context to the partial. Free the function when
            exiting.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0684: Vim9: memory leak when using lambda · vim/vim@f7779c6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0684: Vim9: memory leak when using lambda · vim/vim@f7779c6
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: memory leak when using lambda. Solution: Move the funccal context to the partial. Free the function when exiting.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/41d4299f26cc98e253f9c63f8adc9dbb9d49ed5c|patch 8.2.0687: some tests do not work on FreeBSD>
patch 8.2.0687: some tests do not work on FreeBSD

Problem:    Some tests do not work on FreeBSD.
Solution:   Enable modeline.  Use WaitFor() in more cases. (Ozaki Kiichi,
            closes #6036)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0687: some tests do not work on FreeBSD · vim/vim@41d4299
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0687: some tests do not work on FreeBSD · vim/vim@41d4299
attachments.text: Problem: Some tests do not work on FreeBSD. Solution: Enable modeline. Use WaitFor() in more cases. (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #6036)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/bf67ea1af05cbb30cd8f0b665fb567c0dca79796|patch 8.2.0679: Vim9: incomplete support for closures>
patch 8.2.0679: Vim9: incomplete support for closures

Problem:    Vim9: incomplete support for closures.
Solution:   At the end of a function copy arguments and local variables if
            they are still used by a referenced closure.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0679: Vim9: incomplete support for closures · vim/vim@bf67ea1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0679: Vim9: incomplete support for closures · vim/vim@bf67ea1
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: incomplete support for closures. Solution: At the end of a function copy arguments and local variables if they are still used by a referenced closure.

patch 8.2.0680: PTYGROUP and PTYMODE are unused

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0b6849e9e302286e906d97e4ba017dd66561a9ce|patch 8.2.0681: pattern for 'hlsearch' highlighting may leak>
patch 8.2.0681: pattern for 'hlsearch' highlighting may leak

Problem:    Pattern for 'hlsearch' highlighting may leak. (Dominique Pelle)
Solution:   Call end_search_hl() to make sure the previous pattern is freed.
            (closes #6028)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0681: pattern for 'hlsearch' highlighting may leak · vim/vim@0b6849e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0681: pattern for 'hlsearch' highlighting may leak · vim/vim@0b6849e
attachments.text: Problem: Pattern for 'hlsearch' highlighting may leak. (Dominique Pelle) Solution: Call end_search_hl() to make sure the previous pattern is freed. (closes #6028)

patch 8.2.0682: Vim9: parsing function argument type can get stuck

Problem:    Vim9: parsing function argument type can get stuck.
Solution:   Bail out when not making progress.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5adc55cb746893c6ddf7865ff654582902dee2e3|patch 8.2.0683: Vim9: parsing type does not always work>
patch 8.2.0683: Vim9: parsing type does not always work

Problem:    Vim9: parsing type does not always work.
Solution:   Handle func type without return value.  Test more closures.
            Fix type check offset.  Fix garbage collection.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0683: Vim9: parsing type does not always work · vim/vim@5adc55c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0683: Vim9: parsing type does not always work · vim/vim@5adc55c
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: parsing type does not always work. Solution: Handle func type without return value. Test more closures. Fix type check offset. Fix garbage collection.
